alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 17 at 4:57PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT MONDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Illinois, including the following county, southeastern Cook. Portions of northwest Indiana, including the following county, northwestern Lake IN. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM CDT, trained weather spotters and Doppler Radar estimates indicate that 3 to locally 9 inches of rain fell over the warned area Sunday. Flooding is ongoing. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Hammond, Gary, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Calumet City, Chicago Heights, East Chicago, Lansing, Oak Forest, Harvey, Homer Glen, Blue Island, Munster, Dolton, Park Forest, Homewood, Alsip, Matteson and Frankfort. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
